outputs.output_descr:
UNDP Libya is currently finalising the development of a 2-year rule of law programme in support of the restoration of justice and security in Libya in the context of the country's transition to democracy. This programme will work closely with the integrated United Nations Support Mission in Libya (UNSMIL) and the broader UN Country Team in support of the following three priority outcomes:

1.	Strengthened capacity of Libyan rule of law institutions to provide services in a way which supports the transition to democracy.
2.	Improved access to justice for conflict affected populations especially survivors of sexual and gender-based violence (SGBV), women and the displaced.
3.	Progress achieved in implementation of Transitional Justice process including contributing to national consensus on TJ.

At present, the capacity of the UNDP Country Office is limited. The Initiation Plan is designed to enable the CO to finalise the design of a two-year capacity development project on rule of law, boost the Country Office capacity during this important transition period and implement certain preliminary activities for launching the full-fledged project.

project_title: Strengthen ROL /access to justice in  transition period
